quote: Welcome to Deep Space Nine. I'm   Major Kira.
I'm Dulmur.
Lucsly.  Department of Temporal   Investigations.
We've been expecting you.
I guess you boys from Temporal   Investigations are always on time.
Where's Captain Sisko?
Are you sure you don't want   anything?
Just the truth, Captain.
You'll get it. Where do you want   to start?
The beginning.
If there is such a thing.
Captain, why did you take the   Defiant back in time?
It was an accident.
So you're not contending it was a    Predestination Paradox?
(explaining for the    laymen)   A time loop -- that you were meant   to go back into the past.
Uh, no.
Good.
We hate those.
So. What happened?
This may take some time.
Is that a joke?
No.
Good.
We hate those too.
Two weeks ago the Cardassian    Government contacted me and said    they wanted to return an Orb to    the Bajorans.
Orb?
They're devices of alien origin    that are considered sacred objects    by the Bajoran people.
Each has a unique property, like    the Orb of Prophecy, or the Orb of    Wisdom. The one we received from    the Cardassians was the Orb of    Time, although we didn't know it    at first.
When the Defiant arrived at    Cardassia Prime, we weren't sure    if we were dealing with a genuine    Orb or one of the fakes that've    cropped up over the years.
I had it secured in one of the    crew quarters so we could bring it    back to Bajor for authentication.
But before we left Cardassia, we    took on a passenger.
Humans! I never thought I'd see    another normal face again.
This is Mister Waddle.
Barry, call me Barry.
We are taking him back to the    Federation. He was trapped on    Cardassia when the Klingons    attacked.
I'm a merchant. I deal in    gemstones, kivas and trillium    mostly.        May I?
Help yourself.
Do you know what Cardassians drink    in the morning? Fish juice. Hot    fish juice.        Raktajino.
After six months, I was hoping the    Klingons would invade. At least    they know how to make...       ... coffee, even if they are foul-   smelling barbarians.
Sorry.
Don't take it personally, Worf.
I rather like the way you smell.
Kind of a... peaty, earthy aroma.
With just a touch of lilac.
With the Defiant under cloak we    left Cardassian space and managed    to avoid being detected by the    Klingons.
We were halfway home, and I was    just starting to breath easy.
-- trust me, the next time you see    him, just sniff the air and say    "is that lilac?"
Find somebody else. I have my own    ways of torturing Worf.
Don't look at me.
I'm picking up a massive surge in   chronoton radiation around --
What happened?
I don't know, but we've dropped    out of warp.
Sensors are coming back on-line.
Something's very wrong, Benjamin.    According to the navigational    computer... we're over two    hundred light years from our last    position.
We're decloaking!
Someone's activated the    transporter.
Deactivate it and get us back    under cloak.
I'm picking up another ship dead    ahead.
Can you identify it?
Not yet. But it's close... very    close.
Chief, I need that viewscreen.
I think I've got it...
That's...
The Enterprise
Be specific, Captain. Which   Enterprise? There've been five.
scene: INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CAPTAIN'S OFFICE

quote: Six.
scene: INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CAPTAIN'S OFFICE

quote: This was the first Enterprise.   Constitution class.
scene: INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CAPTAIN'S OFFICE

quote: His ship.
scene: INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CAPTAIN'S OFFICE

quote: James T. Kirk.
scene: INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CAPTAIN'S OFFICE

quote: The one and only.
scene: INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CAPTAIN'S OFFICE

quote: Seventeen separate temporal   violations. The biggest file on   record.
scene: INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CAPTAIN'S OFFICE

quote: The man was a menace.       What was the date of your arrival?
scene: INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CAPTAIN'S OFFICE

quote: Stardate 4523.7.
scene: INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CAPTAIN'S OFFICE

quote: A hundred and five years, one   month, and twelve days ago.
scene: INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CAPTAIN'S OFFICE

quote: A Friday.
scene: INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CAPTAIN'S OFFICE

quote: What was the Enterprise doing?
scene: INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CAPTAIN'S OFFICE

quote: She was orbiting one of the old    Deep Space stations -- K-Seven.    Near the Klingon border.
Security reported that just before    we were thrown back in time,    someone stunned the deputy who was    guarding the orb and broke into    the cabin.
It didn't take long for us to    realize who it was.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: His real name is Arne Darvin. He    is a Klingon altered to look    human.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: His surgeon does nice work.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: We're assuming that he came aboard    the Defiant for the express    purpose of gaining access to the    Orb.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: Any idea why he brought us back to    this point in time?
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: We have a theory. This is Darvin    as he appeared during this time    period. At this moment he is    aboard space station K-7, posing    as a Federation official.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: You're saying he's a spy?
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: The younger Darvin's mission was    to derail Federation colonization    efforts by poisoning a shipment of    grain which was -- which is being    stored aboard the station.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: However, eighteen hours from now,    James Kirk will expose him and    he'll be arrested.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: That arrest will end Darvin's    career. Klingon Intelligence will    turn its back on him. He will    become an outcast.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: From what we've been able to piece    together, he spent the next    hundred years eking out a meager    living posing as a human merchant.    Then in a final indignity -- he    was trapped in Cardassian space by    the Klingon invasion.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: Until he heard rumors about an Orb    capable of taking him back in   time...
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: So what's he planning to do?   Contact his younger self and warn   him about Kirk?
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: He could be planning to kill Kirk.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: The bottom line is we have to find    Darvin and stop him before he    changes history.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: Do we know where he beamed to?
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: No, he wiped the transporter log    when he beamed out.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: Then he could be on the Enterprise    or the station.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: We'll have to search both without    arousing suspicion or altering the    timeline ourselves. The last    thing I want is a visit from    Temporal Investigations when we    get home.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: I guess we'll have to find a way    to blend in.
scene: 14   INT. DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR (OPTICAL)
location: DEFIANT - MESS HALL - ON A MONITOR

quote: Captain.
Lieutenant, actually. Didn't want   to push my luck.
Looks good on you, sir.
Thank you, ensign.
Wait a minute, aren't you two in    the wrong colors?
Don't you know anything    about this time period?
I'm a doctor, not an historian.
In the old days, operations    officers wore red, command    officers wore gold, and --
And women wore less.
I think I'm beginning to like    history...

The original Enterprise used an    old-style duotronic sensor array.    If we wait for just the right    point in the scan cycle, we can    decloak the Defiant for almost    three seconds without being    detected.
Is that enough time to transport    us aboard?
Barely.
Here are the coordinates. The    captain and I will start on Deck    Four and work our way aft. Chief,    you and Julian should go to Deck    Twenty-one...
And work our way forward.
What about the station?
Little of it is habitable. Most    of K-7 consists of storage areas    and industrial fabrication    facilities.
It shouldn't take long to search.    Security isn't as tight as it is    on a starship.
Remember, try to avoid contact    with people from this time period.
We're coming up on a bandshift in    the scan cycle...
Dax.
Nice hat.
Ready?
Deck Twenty-one.
Deck Twenty-one.       I said, Deck Twenty-one.
Maybe if you said please.
What's wrong with this thing?
Don't look at me. I don't know   anything about this time period.
Maybe it's jammed. Help me get    this wall panel off.
Deck Fifteen.
I won't tell anyone if you won't.
They really packed them in on    these old ships.
What about over there?
Perfect -- an auxiliary    communications juncture.
I'll pretend to do repairs,    scan for Darvin.
You know I used to have one    of these... ?
Mn-hm.
I love these classic twenty-third    century designs. The black    finish, the silver highlights --    (letting it hang off her     shoulder)    And it goes with the uniform.
(getting back to     scanning)    Sorry...
-- thanks to you I already have    enough spican flame gems to    me a lifetime.
What's your pleasure?
I'll have a raktajino.
You're the second person today   who's ordered that -- what is it?
Klingon coffee.       The second person? Who was the   first?
He was an older man -- a human.
Where is he now?
I don't know. He left about an   hour ago. I think he said he'd be   back.
Surely you want some...
... Antarean glow water?
We don't have any Klingon   beverages. Would you like   something else?
Tarkalean Tea.
I have something from the far    reaches of the galaxy. Surely you    want --
Not at your price.
Oooh. What is it? Is it alive?
May I hold it?
Chief, you're supposed to be    working...
I'm afraid to touch anything.    It's all cross-circuited and    patched together -- I can't make    heads or tails of it.
Sounds like one of your repair    jobs.
No sign of Darvin in this    section... I'm going to widen the    scan-radius....
If I can figure out how...
Keep the scan field below twenty   milliwatts -- otherwise you'll set   off the internal sensors.
Yes, thank you, Chief -- I was   listening at the mission briefing.
What are you two doing here?
Scotty told me to do this.
Oh -- you were going to do...   this?
It's on the duty roster.
Must've been a mixup.
Isn't that a medical tricorder?
Yes. Yes, it is. I'm a doctor.
Why do we need a doctor to repair    a power relay?
You don't. Obviously.
I'm... doing a study. It has to    do with... work-related stress.
Oh.
You two go on, pretend I'm not    here.
So, where should we start?
Well obviously the first thing to    do is to take this transtator,    here --
And leave it right where it is.
The job pressure's been getting to    him...
Why don't you take over?
All right, Ensign. I think I've    seen enough, let's get you back to    Sickbay.
I'd appreciate it if you didn't    mention this to anyone...
No problem. Hope you feel    better.
I have completed my search of the    primary habitat levels and...
What is that sound?
Soothing isn't it? The bartender    called it a --
A Tribble!
Sit down. You're drawing    attention.
Where did you get that thing?
From a man named Cyrano Jones. He    said Tribbles liked everyone, but    it doesn't seem to like you.
The feeling is mutual. Tribbles    are detestable creatures.
Interesting. It's been my    observation that most humanoids    love soft furry animals...    (getting lost in the     cooing)   ... especially if they make a    pleasing sound.

They do nothing but consume food,    and breed. If you feed that thing    more than the smallest morsel,    within a few hours, you will have    ten Tribbles... then a hundred...    then a thousand...
Calm down.
They were once considered mortal    enemies of the Klingon Empire.
This... a mortal enemy of the    Empire?
They were an ecological menace!    A plague that had to be wiped out!
Wiped out? What're you saying?
Hundreds of warriors were sent to    track them down throughout the    galaxy. An armada obliterated the    Tribbles' homeworld. By the end    of the twenty-third century, they    were eradicated.
Another glorious chapter in    Klingon history. Tell me, do they    still sing songs about the great    Tribble hunt?
Red Alert. Red Alert. All hands    to battle stations. This is not    a drill.
What should we do?
Get to battle stations.
Deck Seven.
Let's see if we can find out    what's going on.
Sisko to Defiant.
Sisko to Defiant.
Defiant here.
Report.
A Klingon D-7 battlecruiser just    dropped out of warp. It's    approaching the station.
Have they locked weapons?
Not yet.
Kira, can you identify the Klingon    vessel?
The IKS Gr'oth.
That's Koloth's ship.
Curzon's old friend?

Yes, and he's not going to attack.    I remember Koloth telling me he    once traded insults with Kirk on    a space station near the   Federation border. He always    regretted not getting a chance to    face him in battle.
The Klingon ship just transported    two people to the station    manager's office, Captain.
That's Koloth!        Maybe we should beam over to the    station and help Odo and Worf. We    know that Darvin was there a few    hours ago and --
I think maybe Doctor Bashir and    Chief O'Brien should go.
But if we went, we might run into    Koloth.
Exactly.
It's not as if he'd recognize me.    I'd love to see him in his prime.
Dax.        Major, beam the Doctor and the   Chief to K-7 and fill them in.
Aye, sir.
It would've been fun.
Too much fun.
Dax was right about the Klingons.    They were only interested in shore    leave...
... and Captain Kirk allowed them   to beam aboard the station in    small groups. when the Enterprise    stood down from Red Alert, we all    resumed our search for Darvin.
... the next bandshift in the    Enterprise scan cycle will be in    three minutes.
We'll be ready, Major. O'Brien out.
We better get to a turbolift.
Hello again.
Hello.
Deck Ten.
Your flap's open.
Excuse me?
On your tricorder. You're   draining power.
Oh.  Thank you.
He's always doing that.
You're a doctor?
Yes.
I just transferred from the   Lexington last week.
Welcome aboard.
I'm coming into Sickbay tomorrow   for my physical.
Fifteen hundred. Lieutenant   Watley.
You realize of course, she was   only using you to get to me.
Watley... that was my great-   grandmother's name.
Funny.
I think she was in Starfleet.
It's a common name.
But what if that was her?
Do you realize the odds... ?

No one ever met my great-   grandfather. This could be a    predestination paradox.        Didn't you take elementary    temporal mechanics at the Academy?    I may be destined to fall in love    with that woman and...       ... become my own great-   grandfather.
You're being ridiculous.
Ridiculous? If I don't meet with    her tomorrow, I may never be born.
Chief, are you ready for    transport?
Are we ever.
Stand by.
You saw the way she looked at me,    you can't just dismiss this.
I can try.
Fine. But I can't wait to see    your face when you get back to    D.S. Nine and find out I never    existed.
Benjamin... look.
Bridge to Captain Kirk.
Kirk here.
Keep working. We're a maintenance    crew just doing our job...
Captain Kirk, this station is    swarming with Klingons.
I was not aware, Mister Barris,    that twelve Klingons constitutes    a swarm.
I had no idea.
What?
He's so much more handsome in    person... and those eyes...
Kirk had quite the reputation as    a ladies' man.
Not him. Spock.
Let's go.
Mister Barris, I have guards    around the grain... I have guards    around the Klingons...
I can't believe you don't want to    at least meet Kirk.
That's the last thing on my mind.
Come on, Benjamin. Are you    telling me you're not the tiniest    bit interested in meeting one of    the most famous men in Starfleet   history?
We have a job to do.
But that's James Kirk.
Look, of course I'd like to meet    him. I'd like to shake his hand    and ask him about...     ...    fighting the Gorn on Cestus    Three -- but that's not why we're   here, old man.
You're right. I guess the    difference between you and me is    that I remember this time -- I    lived in this time. It's hard    to want to be... part of it again.
Clearly we've been going about   this search business all wrong,    Chief.
You're right. Why bother    searching thirty decks, when you    can just plunk yourself down at a    bar and wait for Darvin to come to    you.
We have reason to believe he'll    return to this area.
Ah, yes. The "raktajino."
A vital clue others might've    missed.
How fortunate it's kept you glued    to this bar for the past three    hours --
-- having drinks -- while we've    been crawling through conduits.
My God... that's him.
Who?
Kirk.
Where?
He's just sitting down. The one    in gold, on the left.
That's Kirk?
It would be an honor to meet him.
Let's buy him a drink.
Gentlemen. No one's buying anyone    a drink.
He's right. We can't risk    altering the timeline.
What'll it be, boys? And don't    ask for raktajino -- if I have to    say we don't have that one more    time...
(suddenly very     interested)    Who ordered raktajino?
The Klingons.
Klingons?
Yes.
Right over there.
Those are Klingons?
All right. You boys have had    enough.
Mister Worf... ?
They are Klingons.
It is a... long story.
What happened? Some kind    genetic engineering... ?
A viral mutation... ?
We do not discuss it with    outsiders.
Take it easy, lad. Everybody's   entitled to an opinion.
That's right. And if I think that   Kirk is a Denebian slime devil...
... well, that's my opinion too.
Don't do it, mister. That's an    order.
Look at the way Kirk is ignoring    that Klingon... he's letting the    security officer handle it.
Chief... are you sure that's    Kirk?
Absolutely.
(holding up his own     sleeve)    Then why is he wearing    lieutenant's stripes?
I think we have bigger problems    than a case of mistaken    identity...
Laddie, don't you think you should   rephrase that?
You're right. I should. I didn't    mean to say that the Enterprise    should be hauling garbage... I    meant to say it should be hauled    away as garbage.
What are you doing?
It's Darvin!
Your men could've avoided that    fight, Captain.
Regulation one-fifty-seven,    section three, paragraph eighteen:    Starfleet Officers shall take all    necessary precautions to minimize    any participation in historical    events.
All right. It was a mistake. But    there were no lasting    repercussions.
How do you know that? For all we    know, we could be living in an    alternate timeline right now.
If my people had caused any    changes in the timeline, we    would've been the first to notice    when we got back.
Why do they all have to say that?
So... your men were arrested...
I want to know who started it.
I'm waiting.
Who started the fight?
I don't know, sir.
All right.       Chekov... I know you. You started   it didn't you?
No, sir. I didn't.
Well, who did?
I don't know, sir.
I don't know, sir...
I want to know who threw the first    punch.
All right, you're all confined to    quarters until I find out who    started it. Dismissed.
That was close...
Me. Out of all the people in the    lineup, he asked me who threw the    first punch.
And you lied to him.
I lied to Captain Kirk.       I wish Keiko had been there to see   it.
Sorry about that, little fellow.   Who left you out here all alone?
He's not alone.
Welcome back, Mister Darvin.
The pleasure's all mine.
Worf...
I hope you realize you're facing    some very serious charges when we    get back.
You wouldn't dare put one of the    greatest heroes of the Klingon    Empire into the brig.
You're no hero to the Empire.
I will be.        I've been thinking about my statue    in the Hall of Warriors. I want    it to capture my essence.        Our statues can be so... generic    sometimes, don't you think?
I take it whatever your plan is,    you've already set it in motion.
I see myself standing with Kirk's    head in one hand and...        ... a Tribble in the other.
What have you done? Did you hire    someone to kill him? Did you    sabotage the Enterprise?
Nothing so mundane. Let's just    say that Kirk's death will have a    certain... poetic justice to it.
He put a bomb in a Tribble?
scene: 92   INT. ENTERPRISE - CORRIDOR - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: It's his "revenge."  Originally,    Kirk saw the way a Tribble reacted    to Darvin and realized he was a    Klingon.
scene: 92   INT. ENTERPRISE - CORRIDOR - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: He wouldn't tell us where this...    Tribble is, but he did say it    would go off within the hour.
It could be anywhere...
Benjamin, I think we should risk    going to the bridge. If we can    use the internal sensors, we could    scan the entire ship for    explosives in a matter of seconds.
Dax and I will take care of the    Enterprise. The rest of you beam    over to K-Seven and begin    searching over there.
Understood. But I think Mister    Worf should remain here... it    seems that he's...        ... allergic to Tribbles.
All right.
Captain, I don't think we'll be    able to get to K-Seven's internal    sensors.
Then you'll have to manually scan    every Tribble on the station.
There must be thousands of them by    now.
Hundreds of thousands.
One million, seven hundred and    seventy-one thousand, five hundred    and sixty-one.
That's starting with one Tribble    having an average litter of ten    every twelve hours -- after three    days you'd....
Thank you.        You have your orders, people.    Sisko out.
I re-routed the sensor interface.
It worked.  I'm scanning the   Bridge...       Nothing up here.
That's a relief. When Kirk sat on    that Tribble, I half expected it    to go off.
Nothing on the first six decks...
You wanted to see me, Jim?
I know him...
That must be McCoy -- the ship's    Doctor.
McCoy... McCoy...
The nearest thing I can figure out    is they're born pregnant. Which   seems to be quite a timesaver.
Leonard McCoy. I met him when he    was a student at Ol' Miss.
Who met him -- Curzon?

No, my host at the time was Emony.    I was on Earth judging a    gymnastics competition.         I guess he took my advice.         About becoming a doctor -        I told him he had the hands of a    surgeon.
I get the picture.         I've scanned every deck -- the    bomb's not aboard the ship.
Then it must be somewhere on K-   Seven...
Odo here.
The bomb's not aboard the    Enterprise... It must be over there.
We've only been able to get   through two decks, we're running    out of time.
I can send more teams from the    Defiant.
It's not a question of manpower,    it's a question of multiplication.    The Tribbles are breeding so    quickly, we can't keep up with    them.
Benjamin, maybe we can narrow    things down a little. Presumably,    Darvin put the bomb somewhere he    knows Kirk is going to be in the    next half hour. If we stick close    to Kirk...
He might lead us right to it.
It's worth a try, but there's no    reason for us to stop searching    over here.
Keep at it for now, Constable.
Deck Five.
This is my chicken sandwich and    coffee.
Fascinating.
I want these things off the ship.    I don't care if it takes every    last man we've got, I want them    off the ship.
Aye, they're into the machinery,    all right.
And they're probably into all the    food processors too.
How?
Probably through one of the air    vents.
Captain, there are air vents of   that type on the space station.
And in the storage compartments.
Storage compartments?         Storage compartments!
Most of these are dead...       The grain's poisoned...
I'm picking up a faint tricobalt    signature... the bomb's somewhere    under here.
What's that?
Someone's trying to open one of    the bay doors.
Benjamin! It's right in front of    us... within a meter of where I'm    standing.
They appear to be gorged.
Gorged? On my grain?
Kirk, I'll hold you responsible    for this. There must be   thousands...
Hundreds of thousands.
One million, seven hundred and    seventy-one thousand, five hundred    and sixty-one.
That's assuming one Tribble    multiplying with an average litter    of ten...
Found it...
Sisko to Defiant.
It's dead...
Go ahead, Captain.
We found the bomb -- lock onto my   tricorder's signal and beam it    into space.
Acknowledged...
Kira to Sisko.
It worked.
-- and as captain I want two    things done...
First, find Cyrano Jones...
Second, close that door...
After the bomb was detonated,    history continued uninterrupted.
Kirk uncovered the truth about   Darvin...
scene: 143  INT. K-7 - STATION MANAGER'S OFFICE - CLIP

quote: They don't like you Mister Darvin.   I wonder why.
scene: 143  INT. K-7 - STATION MANAGER'S OFFICE - CLIP

quote: Jim, this man is a Klingon.
scene: 143  INT. K-7 - STATION MANAGER'S OFFICE - CLIP

quote: By the time we returned to the    Defiant, Major Kira had discovered    how to use the Orb to bring us    back to our own time.
And that's when you returned    the present?
Well... not exactly...
Before we left, I realized there    was one last thing I had to do...
Something I'd been thinking about    ever since I saw that ship on the    viewscreen.
Excuse me, captain.
scene: 147  INT. ENTERPRISE - BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: Lieutenant... ? Lieutenant... ?
scene: 147  INT. ENTERPRISE - BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: Benjamin Sisko, sir.
scene: 147  INT. ENTERPRISE - BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: I've been on temporary assignment    here. Before I leave, I just want    to say... it's been an honor    serving with you.
scene: 147  INT. ENTERPRISE - BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: All right, Lieutenant. Carry on.
scene: 147  INT. ENTERPRISE - BRIDGE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: Now if you want to put a letter of    reprimand in my file for that...    go ahead.
We'll have to review the case    before making any recommendations.
However... I don't think there was    any harm done.
I probably would've done the same    thing myself.
You'll be receiving our report in    about a month. But based on what    you've told us... I don't think    you have anything to worry about.
I'm glad to hear it.
Good-bye, Captain.
Good-bye.
Docking Port Seven.
It went well?
Good.       The constable wants to see us. On   the Promenade.
Did you tell them?
They didn't ask.
I'm open to suggestions, people.
We could... build another station.
